casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca

address.verbatim-address: CP du Musée, BP 49714, Montréal, QC H3T 2A5, Canada

org-entry.content-note: aims to develop a francophone univ. community, through building partnerships with students, teachers, institutions and govts
publ. Le Français à l’Uni­versité (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 27 ave de Ségur, 75007 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to work for human rights and the emancipation of the Jewish people
has subsequently focused on education
maintains 40 schools in France, the Mediterranean area and Canada
org-entry.stats: library of 150,000 vols, 3,000 periodicals and 1,000 manuscripts; also maintains a digital library

org-entry-head.alt-name: Association mondiale des sciences de l’éducation
Asociación mundial de ciencias de la educación
World Association for Educational Research

address.verbatim-address: ESPE de Reims, 23 rue Clément Ader, BP 165, 51680 Reims, Cedex 2, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage research in educational sciences by organizing con­gresses, issuing publs and supporting the exchange of information

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Arab Bureau of Education for the Gulf States

address.verbatim-address: Riyadh 12511-3113, Saudi Arabia

org-entry.content-note: co-ordinates and pro­motes co-operation and integration among mem. countries in the fields of education, culture, science, information and documentation
aims to unify the educational systems of all Gulf Arab states

includes the Gulf Arab States’ Educational Research Center (POB 25566, Safat, Kuwait), Arab Educational Training Center for Gulf States (Doha), and Arabic Language Educational Center for Gulf States (Sharjah)
mems: Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen
publs Risalat Ul-Khaleej al-Arabi (quarterly), Arab Gulf Journal of Scientific Research (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: POB 4, Klong Luang, Pathumthani 12120, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: Masters and doctoral progs are offered at the School of Engineering and Technology (SET), the School of Environment, Resources and Development (SERD), and the School of Management (SOM)
continuing education progs are offered by AIT Extension, and consultancy through AIT Solutions
publs AIT Annual Report , AIT Newsletter

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Asia South Pacific Association for Basic and Adult Education (ASPBAE)

address.verbatim-address: Unit 106, Sterten Place Condominium, 116 Maginhawa St, Teachers Village, Diliman, Quezon City 1101, Philippines

org-entry.found-date: 1964, as Asian South Pacific Bureau of Adult Education
org-entry.content-note: aims to assist non-formal education and adult literacy
organizes training courses and seminars
provides material and advice relating to youth and adult education
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 264 orgs in 31 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs ASPBAE ­e-Bulletin , ASPBAE Ed-Lines (3 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association for the Development of Education in Africa

address.verbatim-address: Immeuble CCIA, Abidjan Plateau, Ave Jean-Paul II, 01 BP 1387, Abidjan 01, Côte d’Ivoire

org-entry.found-date: 1988 as Donors to African Education, present name adopted in 1995
org-entry.content-note: aims to enhance collaboration in the support of African education

promotes policy dialogue and undertakes research, advocacy and capacity building in areas of education in sub-Saharan Africa through progs and working groups comprising representatives of donor countries and African mins of education
serves 87 mins of education in Africa
publ. Kibare: Non-formal Education and Literacy Journal

address.verbatim-address: Koninginneweg 161, 1075 CN Amsterdam, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: propagates the ideals and educational methods of Dr Maria Montessori on child devt
organizes training courses for teachers in 28 countries
Int. Montessori Congress held every 4 years (2023: Thailand, in Aug.)
publs AMI Journal (2 a year), AMI Bulletin

org-entry-head.alt-name: Association des universités africaines

address.verbatim-address: POB 5744, Accra-North, Ghana

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote exchanges, contact and co-operation among African univ. institutions and to collect and disseminate information on research and higher education in Africa
convenes a General Conference, normally every 4 years
publ. AAU Newsletter (3 a year)

address.verbatim-address: POB 401, Amman 11941, Jordan

org-entry.content-note: a scientific conf. is held every 3 years; council meetings held annually
publ. AARU Journal

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of Caribbean University, Research and Institutional Libraries (ACURIL)

address.verbatim-address: POB 23317, UPR Station, San Juan 00931-3317, Puerto Rico

org-entry.content-note: holds annual confs, meet­ings and seminars
facilitates co-operation and the pooling of resources in research
encourages exchange of staff and students

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of Management Development Institutions in South Asia

address.verbatim-address: University of Hyderabad Campus, Central University Post Office, Hyderabad 500 046, India

org-entry.content-note: supports business schools by linking with leaders interested in management devt, promotes professional devt of management faculty, provides institution-building assistance to business schools and corporate management devt centres in the region
organizes institution-building workshops and facilitates inter-institutional co-operative research on contemporary managerial issues
affiliated to SAARC
org-entry.stats: mems: 293 regional institutional mems, 8 assoc. mem. and 15 reciprocal mems
org-entry.content-note: publs Newsletter (3 a year), South Asian Journal of Management (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of South-East Asian Institutions of Higher Learning (ASAIHL)

address.verbatim-address: Chaloem Rajakumari 60 Bldg, 16th Floor, Chulalongkorn University, Phyathai Rd, Bangkok 10330, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the eco­nomic, cultural and social welfare of the people of South-East Asia by means of educational co-operation and research pro­gs
also aims to cultivate a sense of regional identity and interdependence
collects and disseminates information, organizes discussions

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of Universities of Latin America and the Caribbean
org-entry-head.alt-name: Unión de Universi­dades de América Latina y el Caribe—UDUAL

address.verbatim-address: Ricardo Flores Magón 1, piso 9, Colonia Nonoalco-Tlatelolco, Delegation Cuauhtémoc, 06995 Ciudad de México, Mexico

org-entry.content-note: promotes good relations between institutions; organizes exchanges between professors, students, research fellows and graduates
arranges confs
conducts statistical research
maintains centre for univ. documentation
publs Universidades (2 a year), Gaceta UDUAL (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) Institute

address.verbatim-address: 376 Nanchang Rd, Sha Yi Ba Ke District, Urumqi, Xinjiang, People’s Republic of China

org-entry.found-date: 2006, secretariat inaugurated in 2015 and a formal agreement establishing the Institute entered into effect in 2017
org-entry.content-note: aims to facilitate regional projects and policy initiatives focused on CAREC’s aims of achieving sustainable economic growth and devt in the region
aims to build a network of research institutes
awarded observer status at the UN General Assembly in 2020

address.verbatim-address: 1100 15th St, NW, 4th Floor, Washington, DC 20005, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1892 as the International Kindergarten Union; name changed to Asscn for Children Education International in 1946, present name adopted in 2019
org-entry.content-note: works to support the education of children by promoting desirable conditions in schools, raising the standard of teaching, co-operating with all groups concerned with children, informing the public of the needs of children
administers a Center for Education Diplomacy and Leadership
publs Childhood Education Innovations (6 a year), Journal of Research in Childhood Education (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Blk C, DepEd Complex, Meralco Ave, Pasig City 1600, Metro Manila, Philippines

org-entry.found-date: 1973 with the support of mem. govts of the Co­lombo Plan
org-entry.content-note: aims to en­hance technician education systems in developing mem. countries
org-entry.stats: mems: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Fiji, India, Malaysia, Maldives, Myanmar, Mongolia, Nepal, Pakistan, Papua New Guinea, Philippines, Singapore, Sri Lanka, Thailand
org-entry.content-note: publ. CPSC Quarterly
promotes teaching and research in comparative and international education
organizes confs and promotes literature (29th CESE Conf.: Thessaloniki, Greece, in July 2024)
publ. Journal of European Education , Newsletter (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: 88 rue Gachard, 1050 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.found-date: 1971 as the European Foundation for Management Development, through merger of the European Association of Management Training Centres and the International University Contact for Man­agement Education
org-entry.content-note: aims to help to improve the quality of management devt, disseminate information and promote international co-operation
administers leadership progs
extends accreditation and certification, incl. through EQUIS (EFMD Quality Improvement System) and EPAS (EFMD Programme Accreditation System)
publs Global Focus , Newsletter

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Association for the Education of Adults

address.verbatim-address: 10 rue de l'Industrie, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to create a `learning society’ by encouraging demand for learning, particularly for under-represented groups
holds an annual congress

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Federation for Catholic Adult Education
org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Européene pour l’Éducation Catholique des Adultes—FEECA

address.verbatim-address: Rheinweg 34, 53113 Bonn, Germany

org-entry.content-note: aims to strengthen international contact between mems and to assist with international research and practical projects in adult education
holds conf. every 2 years

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Union of Arabic and Islamic Scholars
org-entry-head.alt-name: Union Euro­péenne des Arabisants et Islamisants—UEAI

org-entry.content-note: organizes congress of Arabic and Islamic Studies every 2 years

address.verbatim-address: 24 ave de l’Yser, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.found-date: 2001 by merger of the Association of European Universities and the Confederation of EU Rectors’ Conferences
org-entry.content-note: represents European univs and national rectors’ confs; promotes the devt of a coherent system of European higher education and research through projects and membership services; provides support and guidance to mems
publ. Annual Report

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Global Coalition to Protect Education from Attack

address.verbatim-address: 350 Fifth Ave, 34th Floor, New York, NY 10118-3299

org-entry.content-note: advocates to prevent attacks on education perpetrated by non-state armed groups or state security forces
contributed to the devt of Guidelines for Protecting Schools and Universities from Military Use during Armed Conflict (2014)

supports the implementation of the Safe Schools Declaration, adopted in May 2015 by the First International Conference on Safe Schools (endorsed by 118 govts by Jan. 2024; the Fourth International Conference on Safe Schools was hosted in Oct. 2021 by Nigeria, the AU Commission and other partners, in a hybrid in-person and virtual format
guided by a Steering Cttee comprising Amnesty International , Human Rights Watch , Plan International , Protect Education in Insecurity and Conflict, Save the Children, UNICEF , and UNESCO

address.verbatim-address: 7-9 chemin de Balexert, Chãtelaine, 1291 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote lifelong learning
to work for improvement of the status of women and girls
to encourage and enable women as leaders and decision makers
Gen. Assembly held every 3 years (2022: in a virtual format, in Nov.)
org-entry.stats: affiliates: 62 nat. asscns and feds in 54 countries

address.verbatim-address: Westvest 7, 2611 AX Delft, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: activities include education, training and research; co-ordination of a global network of water sector orgs; advisory and policymaking functions; setting international standards for postgraduate education progs; and professional training in the water sector
a UNESCO category 2 institute

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Inter-American Centre for Knowledge Development in Vocational Training
org-entry-head.alt-name: Centro Interamericano para el Desarrollo del Conocimiento en la Formación Profesional—OIT/CINTERFOR

address.verbatim-address: Avda Uruguay 1238, Montevideo, Uruguay

org-entry.content-note: services are provided in documentation, research, ex­change of experience
holds seminars, research and courses

org-entry-head.alt-name: Confederación Interamericana de Educación Católica—CIEC

address.verbatim-address: Calle 78, No. 12-16, Bogotá 101 DC, Colombia

org-entry.content-note: aims to defend and extend the principles and rules of Catholic education, freedom of education, and human rights
organizes congress every 3 years
publ. Educación Hoy

address.verbatim-address: 7077 ave du Parc, Suite 2043 Montréal, QC H3N 1X7, Canada

org-entry.content-note: organizes a biennial Conference of the Americas on International Education (Las Vegas, USA, in Nov. 2023)

address.verbatim-address: Münchendorfer Str. 2, 2361 Laxenburg, Austria

org-entry.found-date: 2011, initiated by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL) , the European Anti-Fraud Office, Austria and others
org-entry.content-note: IACA aims to promote effective and efficient prevention and combating of corruption through education and training, research, technical assistance, and international co-operation.

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association for Educational and Vocational Guidance (IAEVG)

address.verbatim-address: c/o IAEVG/Canadian Career Devt Foundation, 19 Ross Ave, Suite 202, Ottawa, ON K1Y 0N6, Canada

org-entry.content-note: aims to contribute to the devt of vocational guidance and promote contact between persons associated with it
holds annual international conf. (2024: Jyväskylä, Finland, in Nov.)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 20,000 individuals in 45 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs International Journal for Educational and Vocation Guidance (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Educators for World Peace

address.verbatim-address: POB 3282, Mastin Lake Station, Huntsville, AL 35810-0282, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to develop education designed to contribute to the promotion of peaceful relations at personal, community and international level
publs Diplomacy Journal (every 3 months), Peace Education Journal (annually), other articles and irregular publs

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Physical Education in Higher Education
org-entry-head.alt-name: Association Internationale des Écoles Supérieures d’Éducation Physique—AIESEP

address.verbatim-address: c/o School of Education, University College, 1-2 Lucan Pl., Western Rd, Cork, Ireland

org-entry.content-note: organizes congresses, exchanges and research in physical education and sport pedaogogy

address.verbatim-address: 1 rue Miollis, 75732 Paris Cedex 15, France

org-entry.content-note: established to promote co-operation at international level among univs and other institutions and orgs of higher education
provides clearing house services and operates the jt IAU/UNESCO Information Centre on Higher Education

brings together institutions and orgs from some 120 countries for reflection and action on common concerns, and collaborates with various international, regional and national bodies active in higher education
maintains a World Higher Education Database
holds a General Conf. every 4 years (2022: Dublin, Ireland, in Oct.)
publs Higher Education Policy (quarterly), IAU Horizons (2 a year), IAU Lynx (monthly e-bulletin), International Handbook of Universities (annually)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Universities of the Third Age

org-entry.content-note: brings together universities of the third age in support of life-long learning and education for the older generation

address.verbatim-address: Zum Ehrenhain 34, 22885 Barsbüttel, Germany

org-entry.content-note: promotes co-operation between mem. libraries and stimulate research on relevant issues
publ. IATUL Pro­ceed­ings

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of University Professors and Lecturers (IAUPL)
org-entry-head.alt-name: Association Internationale des Professeurs et Maîtres de Conférence Universitaires

address.verbatim-address: 1 rue Guy de la Brosse, 75005, Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: works to develop academic fraternity among univ. teachers and research workers
the protection of independence and freedom of teaching and research
the furtherance of the interests of all univ. teachers
and the consideration of academic problems

address.verbatim-address: 15 route des Morillons 1218, Grand-Saconnex, Geneva 15, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: administers the curricula and international univ. entrance examination, the International Baccalaureate diploma, recog­nized by major univs worldwide
offers the Primary Years Programme for children aged 3-12 years, the Middle Years Programme for students aged 11-16 years, and the Diploma Programme for 17-18 year-olds
Global Centres are located in Singapore, Cardiff (Wales, UK), The Hague (Netherlands), Washington, DC (USA)
publ. IB World Schools Yearbook

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Catholic Federation for Physical and Sports Education
org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Internationale Catholique d’Education Physique et Sportive—FICEP

address.verbatim-address: 22 rue Oberkampf, 75011 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: organizes meetings, and promotes research and international co-operation

address.verbatim-address: 9 Garsije Lorke, Belgrade, Serbia

org-entry.content-note: General Assembly meets every 4 years
org-entry.stats: mems: 7 reg. orgs and over 800 literacy, adult and lifelong learning asscns in more than 75 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Convergence (quarterly), ICAE News

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council for Open and Distance Education (ICDE)

address.verbatim-address: Pløens gate 2 b , 0181 Oslo, Norway

org-entry.found-date: 1938 as the International Council for Correspondence Education, present name adopted in 1982
org-entry.content-note: furthers distance education by promoting research, encouraging regional links, providing information and organizing confs
30th ICDE World Conference (Wellington, New Zealand, in Nov. 2025)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 230 mems in 70 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Open Praxis (online)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council of Sport Science and Physical Education

address.verbatim-address: Hans-Braun Str. 1, 14053 Berlin, Germany

org-entry.content-note: facilitates collaboration, supports research and promotes exercise as means of improving quality of life
org-entry.stats: 230 nat. and reg. orgs and institutes

address.verbatim-address: International House, 76 Bennett Rd, Brighton, East Sussex, BN2 5JL, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote knowledge and foster the art of dance in all its forms
to offer a comprehensive range of professional qualifications in all dance genres

org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération internationale pour l’éducation des parents—FIEP

address.verbatim-address: 1 ave Léon Journault, 92318 Sèvres Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: works to gather experts from different scientific fields and those responsible for family education in their own countries and to encourage the establishment of family education where it does not exist

org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération internationale d’universités catholiques—FIUC

address.verbatim-address: 21 rue d’Assas, 75270 Paris Cedex 06, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to ensure a strong bond of mutual assistance among all Catholic univs in the search for truth
to help to solve problems of growth and devt, and to co-operate with other international orgs
a Foresight Unit reports on trends and innovations in the higher education sector
org-entry.stats: mems: 226 in more than 50 countries, 6 reg. asscns
org-entry.content-note: publ. Monthly Newsletter

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA)

address.verbatim-address: POB 95312, 2509 CH The Hague, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: promotes international co-operation in librarianship and bibliography, supports professional devt, and advocates for libraries
organizes a (normally) annual World Library and Information Congress (2023: in Rotterdam, Netherlands, in Aug.)
publs IFLA Annual Report , IFLA Journal

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Physical Education, Fitness and Sports Science Associations
org-entry-head.alt-name: IFPEFSSA

address.verbatim-address: Flat No.404, Block-A, Brindavan Apts Lakdikapul, 500004, Hyderabad, India

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote sports science and research with a focus on physical education and fitness

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Teachers of Modern Languages
org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Internationale des Professeurs de Langues Vivantes

org-entry.content-note: holds meetings on every aspect of foreign-language teaching
World Congress (2022: in Warsaw, Poland, in June)
has consultative status with UNESCO
org-entry.stats: mems: 30 nat. and reg. language asscns and 10 int. unilingual asscns

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Workers’ Education Associations

address.verbatim-address: c/o Labour Research Service, POB 376, Woodstock 7915, Cape Town, South Africa

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation between non-governmental bodies concerned with workers’ education
organizes clearing house services
promotes exchange of information
holds international seminars, confs and summer schools
publs IFWEA e-Bulletin (quarterly), International Labor and Working-Class History

org-entry-head.alt-name: Instituto Internacional de Literatura Iberoamericana

address.verbatim-address: 1312 Cathedral of Learning, University of Pittsburgh, PA 15260, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to advance the study of Iberoamerican literature, and intensify cultural relations among the peoples of the Americas
holds Congress of the International Institute of Latin American Literature (2023: Athens, Greece)
org-entry.stats: mems: scholars and artists in 37 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Revista Iberoamericana (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: POB 7168, Newark, DE 19714-7168, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1956, as International Reading Asscn, to improve the quality of reading instruction at all levels, to promote the habit of lifelong reading, and to develop every reader’s profi­ciency
org-entry.content-note: publs The Reading Teacher (6 a year), Journal of Adolescent and Adult Literacy (6 a year), Reading Research Quarterly , Literacy Today (6 a year)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Office International de l’Enseignement Catholique

address.verbatim-address: Casa Generalice La Salle, Via Aurelia 476, 00160 Rome, Italy

org-entry.content-note: co-ordinates the activities of mems and the study of issues relating to Catholic education
org-entry.stats: mems: 110 countries, 20 assoc. mems, 11 collaborating mems
org-entry.content-note: publs OIEC Bulletin (every 3 months, in English, French and Spanish), OIEC Tracts on Education

address.verbatim-address: 3 rue Schaub, 1202 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to co-ordinate work in international schools and to promote international education and understanding by guiding schools in developing an international curriculum
convenes confs and annual Youth Leadership Encounters on topics of global concern; organizes specialist seminars on internationalism and international-mindedness
also issues self-study guides and certificates, and provides consultancy services and examination progs in oral English
has consultative status at UNESCO

org-entry-head.alt-name: Société Internationale pour l'Enseignement Commercial—SIEC

org-entry.content-note: encourages international exchange of information
organizes courses and congresses on business education
publ. International Journal for Business Education

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Society for Education through Art (INSEA)

address.verbatim-address: Quinta da Cruz, Estrada de São Salvador, 3510-784 São Salvador, Viseu, Portugal

org-entry.content-note: unites art teachers throughout the world, promotes the exchange information and co-ordinates research into art education
organizes international congresses (2023: Çanakkale, Türkiye, in Sept.) and exhibitions of children’s art
org-entry.stats: mems: 80 orgs and 1,184 individual mems in 72 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs International Journal of Education through Art (3 a year), IMAG (e-magazine)

address.verbatim-address: Suite 148, 45 Glenferrie Rd, Malvern, Victoria 3144, Australia

org-entry.content-note: acts as advisory body to UNESCO in matters of music education
organizes biennial World Conference (2024: Helsinki, Finland, in July-Aug.)
org-entry.stats: mems: nat. cttees and individuals in more than 80 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs ISME Newsletter , International Journal of Music Education

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Society for the Study of Medieval Philosophy (SIEPM)

address.verbatim-address: Institute of Philosophy Kardinaal Mercierplein 2, 3000 Leuven, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: promotes the study of medieval thought and the collaboration between individuals and institutions in this field
organizes International Congress of Medieval Philosophy every 5 years (2022: Paris, France, in Aug.)
publ. Bulletin de Philosophie Médiévale (annually)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Internationale Jugendbiblio­thek

address.verbatim-address: Schloss Blutenburg, 81247 Munich, Germany

org-entry.found-date: 1949, since 1953 an associated project of UNESCO
org-entry.content-note: promotes the international exchange of children’s literature
provides study opportunities for specialists in childrens’ books
maintains a library of more than 660,000 volumes in about 250 languages
publs The White Ravens , Das Bücherschloss , catalogues

address.verbatim-address: Ismail Al-A’asoufi St, Khilda, Amman 11183, Jordan

org-entry.content-note: serves as a consultative organization of the OIC and developing countries in the field of science and technology
convenes international scientific conferences
organizes and supports capacity building workshops in basic sciences in developing countries
provides experts and consultants in science and technology to developing countries upon request
publ. The Medical Journal (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Via Giovanni Paisiello 24, 00198 Rome, Italy

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote Italian culture in Latin America
awarded observer status at the UN General Assembly in 2007

org-entry-head.alt-name: Association of European Research Libraries
Ligue des Bibliothèques Européennes de Recherche

address.verbatim-address: National Library of the Netherlands, POB 90407, 2509 LK The Hague, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage collaboration between the general research libraries of Europe, and national and univ. libraries in particular
promotes practical ways of improving the quality of the services provided
org-entry.stats: mems: 420 libraries, library orgs and individuals in 40 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. LIBER Quarterly

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Organization of Ibero-American States for Education, Science and Culture
org-entry-head.alt-name: Organización de Estados Iberoamericanos para la Educación, la Ciencia y la Cultura—OEI

address.verbatim-address: Calle Bravo Murillo 38, 28015 Madrid, Spain

org-entry.content-note: promotes peace and solidarity between mem. countries, through education, science, technology and culture
provides information, encourages exchanges and organizes training courses
the General Assembly (at ministerial level) meets every 4 years
publ. Revista Iberoamericana de Educación (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Egypt St, House no. 1986, 1165 Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

org-entry.found-date: 2020, as the Organization of Educational Cooperation, present name adopted in June 2023
org-entry.content-note: at the inaugural regular session of the General Assembly, held in Dec. 2021, in Geneva, Switzerland, an 8-year strategic plan was adopted, titled `Building the Education we Need—Shaping the Future we Want’, focused on enhancing systemic governance and policy frameworks; building capacities in balanced and inclusive education; democratizing knowledge and research; bridging the techno-digital divide; enhancing horizontal and cross-sectoral co-operation; strengthening solidarity-based financing and sustainable debt agreements; and reinforcing South-South co-operation and integration
an extraordinary session of the General Assembly was convened in June 2023

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Organization of the Catholic Universities of Latin America
org-entry-head.alt-name: Organización de Universidades Católicas de América Latina—ODUCAL

address.verbatim-address: Avda Tepeyac 4800, Edif. 5, 1° piso, Jalisco, Mexico

org-entry.content-note: aims to assist the social, economic and cultural devt of Latin America through the promotion of Catholic higher education in the continent
publs Anuario , Sapientia , Universitas

org-entry.found-date: 1995, recognized as an affiliated body of SAARC in 1997
org-entry.content-note: collectively represents national University Womens’ Associations in the region
brings together women graduates in the region
has National Chapters in Bangladesh, India, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka
secretariat rotates between mems

address.verbatim-address: Lalitpur, Nepal

org-entry.content-note: recognized as an affiliated body of SAARC in 2002
aims to represent and work towards the welfare of teachers in South Asia
emphasizes a focus on the teaching community’s impact on regional social devt and related issues
secretariat rotates between mem. states
Education International (EI) financially assists STF in its activities
org-entry.stats: mems: 17 EI affiliates from 6 countries (Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: South Asian Network of Economic Research Institutes

address.verbatim-address: Institute for Integrated Development Studies, POB 2254, Mandikhatar, Kathmandu, Nepal

org-entry.content-note: works to support research capacity building in South Asia, and aims to establish a network of economic policy research in the subcontinent

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Southeast Asian Ministers of Education Organization (SEAMEO)

address.verbatim-address: M. L. Pin Malakul Bldg, 920 Sukhumvit Rd, Bangkok 10110, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: promotes co-operation among the South-East Asian nations through projects in education, science and culture
SEAMEO has 21 regional centres including BIOTROP for tropical biology, in Bogor, Indonesia
INNOTECH for educational innovation and technology, in the Philippines
SEAMOLEC, an open learning centre, in Indonesia
RECSAM for education in science and math­ematics, in Penang, Malaysia
SEN for supporting the special educational needs of disabled and gifted children
RELC for languages, in Singapore
RIHED for higher education devt, in Bangkok, Thailand
SEARCA for graduate study and research in agriculture, in Los Baños, Philippines
SPAFA for archaeology and fine arts, in Bangkok
TROPMED for tropical medicine and public health, in Bangkok
VOCTECH for vocational and tech­nical education

QITEPs, regional centres for quality improvement of teachers and education personnel, for language, based in Jakarta, Indonesia, for mathematics, in Yogyakarta, Indonesia, and for science, in Bandung, Indonesia
RETRAC, a training centre, in Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam
CELLL, promoting lifelong learning, in Ho Chi Minh City
and the SEAMEO Regional Centre for History and Tradition (CHAT) in Yangon, Myanmar
org-entry.stats: mems: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao People’s Democratic Rep., Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Viet Nam; assoc. mems: Australia, Canada, Germany, Morocco, New Zealand, Spain; 6 affiliate mems
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , Journal of Southeast Asian Education

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality

address.verbatim-address: Plot 4775, Notwane Rd, Gaborone, Botswana

org-entry.content-note: aims to undertake integrated research and training activities in order to develop the capacities of education planners to enhance the evaluation and monitoring of the condition of schools and the quality of education
receives technical assistance from UNESCO International Institute for Educational Planning (IIEP)
org-entry.stats: mems: Ministries of Education in 16 countries of the region

org-entry-head.alt-name: Universala Esperanto-Asocio

address.verbatim-address: Nieuwe Binnenweg 176, 3015 BJ Rotterdam, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: promotes the learning of the international language, Esperanto, and facilitates the practical use of the language
organizes World Congresses (2024: Arusha, Tanzania, in Aug.)
publs Esperanto (monthly), Kontakto (every 2 months), Monato (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: The University of the South Pacific, Laucala Campus, Suva, Fiji

org-entry.content-note: comprises 3 main campuses (in Fiji, Samoa and Vanuatu), 14 regional campuses and 3 faculties (arts and law; business and economics; and science, technology and environment)
mems: Cook Islands, Fiji, Kiribati, Marshall Islands, Nauru, Niue, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tokelau, Tonga, Tuvalu, Vanuatu
publs USP Annual Report , USP Beat (monthly), USP Calendar (annually)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Conseil des examens de l’Afrique orientale

address.verbatim-address: POB GP 125, Accra, Ghana

org-entry.content-note: administers prescribed examinations in mem. countries
aims to harmonize examina­tions procedures and standards; offices in each mem. country and in London, UK
org-entry.stats: mems: The Gambia, Ghana, Liberia, Nigeria, Sierra Leone

org-entry-head.alt-name: Union mondiale des enseignants catholiques—UMEC

address.verbatim-address: Palazzo San Callisto 00120, Vatican City

org-entry.content-note: encourages the grouping of Catholic teachers for the greater effectiveness of Catholic schools, distributes documentation on Catholic doctrine with regard to education, and facilitates personal contacts through congresses, and seminars, etc., nationally and internationally
publ. Nouvelles de l’UMEC
